newsitem.title: INDIA: India's Deve Gowda says government means business.
newsitem.headline: India's Deve Gowda says government means business.

text.p: Indian Prime Minister H.D. Deve Gowda said on Thursday that capital markets perked up after he reassured industrialists last month.

"There was this decline in the capital market for a few days, weeks. After the 31st (December) meeting, you have all witnessed there is some improvement," Deve Gowda told the Confederation of Indian Industry's annual meeting in Calcutta.
"This itself is a clear indication that the government means business," he said.

Deve Gowda met industrialists on December 31 and listened to their proposals on how to arrest a slowdown in industrial growth. He told them at that time that his government would take steps by mid-January to boost capital markets.
The government last week announced capital gains tax exemptions to boost investment in infrastructure companies.
On Thursday, Deve Gowda promised more decisions before he leaving for a world economic summit in Davos, Switzerland, which begins later this month.
